translated: In the same scroll, the fourth line on the twenty-ninth page, which is now the fourth line on the thirty-seventh page of the correct text, below Niṣaṇṇa-pāyantika, from the twelfth day up to the thirtieth day, all as explained above, the Dunhuang version does not have these twelve characters in the middle, but has nine lines of text starting with Again, a bhikṣu obtains an incomplete robe up to Niṣaṇṇa-pāyantika, which are not found in the Guojia version or the Song version.
